title.rendered: Book Signing Saturday July 12 & Weekly News!

content.rendered:
Join us for Book Signing Saturday!

This Saturday (July 12) we are proud to host a book signing at our Warner Robins location from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. with Kathryn Sneed. She will be signing copies of her book Journey Through Deployment: Stepping Forward With Confidence During Military Separations.

Learn more about Kathryn & her book!

About Her Book

Deployment is an uncertain time filled with many fears. You may wonder how you will get through each day, how you will cope, and what you will do during this time. The fears and worries can be endless. But the journey doesn’t have to be intimidating. You too, can learn to step forward with confidence and experience hope, joy, and encouragement in deployment.

Thank you, Mayor Toms!

We had a particularly civic-minded storyteller in the house for yesterday’s Kids’ Corner. Here is Warner Robins Mayor Randy Toms reading to some of the city’s youngest citizens.

Our next Kids’ Corner will be at our Macon store at 10:00 a.m. on Wednesday, July 16. We will have snacks, drinks, giveaways, and a guest reader! Hope to see you there.

 

Red, White, and Blue Books

Gottwals Warner Robins is located a mere ten miles from Robins Air Force Base, so it’s no surprise we have an extensive collection of aviation reference and military history.

All four Gottwals locations offer a selection of military memoirs and historical accounts, as well as lots of military/espionage fiction! We carry old-guard writers like Herman Wouk and Leon Uris, newer standard-bearers including Tom Clancy, W.E.B. Griffin, and Robert Ludlum, and lesser-known authors like Jack Coughlin and Larry Bond.

For a romantic spin on the soldier story, you might try Maya Banks, Suzanne Brockman, and in Christian fiction, Dee Henderson.

Toy of the Week

Shape-Sorting Clock: $14.97

This colorful wooden clock features 12 shaped wooden blocks that fit into matching slots, and it has movable hands for great teaching moments!
